## How leavening works:

Leavening ingredients contain an acid or a base.  Most recipes will specify which one, so it is important to pay attention to the recipe.  Often the ingredients are both, but they can be either.  If they are both, what’s the difference between them?
The reaction between baking soda and acetic acid is one of the processes that make leavening ingredients work.  In general, the process goes as follows:

Acetic acid and baking soda create CO2 gas.  The gas is released as a leavening component.
There are other components of the process, but the reaction is typically this one: 
Acetic acid + Baking Soda -> CO2 + Water 
The reaction between the dough and the baking soda is often referred to as “baking”.

As a general rule, the acid will react much faster than the baking soda.  Basically, the acid will begin the process of creating CO2 much sooner.  The baking soda, while it has an acid, helps with the process by neutralizing/neutralizing the acid. There are also other processes that happen in the baking.  Usually, after the baking is complete, or the baking time is over, the baked good will be cooked.  This happens when the baking soda and acetic acid react with oxygen, and cause the food to cook.  
The next process is the reaction between the acid and the oxygen.  In general this is called “baking”. 
Acetic acid and oxygen will react to create CO2 gas, which is what is used to make baked goods rise.  
After the baking is complete, you can feel the baked good in your hands.  At this point, the baking is done.  
When you eat the baked good, you will discover that the baking process is over, but the baking is not completely done yet. 
Once you eat the baked good, the next process of the life cycle of the baked good begins.  This results in a cycle that happens for many days after you eat the baked good, and helps the baked good to continue to rise.  This process results in the baked good to slowly decompose. The decayed components of the baked good can be found in the ground after you’ve eaten the baked good for days.  The component that comes from the first process, “baking”, is called “dough”.  It is the bottom half of the baked good, and it will last for years

Please write a short summary for the following article:

14 Times That Your Love For Food Made You Gain Weight

Let’s face it: You’re addicted to food.

And now it’s coming to your rescue: Science has invented a way to reverse that addiction, using stem cells (via CNN). The stem cells are fed a diet of glucose. If the researchers are successful, the cells should grow the size of your stomachs and the cells in your small intestine and colon should also be able to shrink.

Stem cells can repair faulty cells in the body, but this is the first time that they’d actually fed these cells glucose to repair a cell. “This is the first time that we as scientists have gone ahead and shown that [the cells] could be reprogrammed to eat food,” said study co-author Dr. Amin Sorab, of UIC Institute of In vitro Medicine and Science.

If it works, it could help people struggling with obesity and other health problems. I mean, the food is glucose, not actual food, which is also a good thing, since it isn’t as calorie-packed as actual food. But it could still help, which is to say, if it helps, it could help.

So will the food really trick the cells to eat the food? That might take some work. For one thing, it’s more complicated than simply feeding the cells glucose; the cells need to use their natural mechanisms to take in the glucose and convert it, as well as the rest of the food. The researchers might have a few successes, but they don’t know for sure yet.

Also, the food is only glucose. But that’s better than actual food, so that would be a good first step.

For more science:

Summary: A study has found that using stem cells to feed the cells in your body glucose can help them repair damaged cells that could contribute to a person struggling with obesity and other health problems. If successful, it could potentially reverse the problem, although the exact results are still uncertain.

Here are some questions and contexts that can help you imagine what a person might say to their friends about wedding planning, along with some scenarios where this might be possible:

## What's the best idea to do about the guest list?

### Scenario:

A friend is planning a wedding and wants to reduce their guest list from 200 to 50. One idea they have is to ask relatives to only bring a small gift, as they don't want to put people on the guest list that they're already meeting on their wedding day. This sounds like a reasonable but potentially limiting strategy that might work in some cases.

## How is this going to affect logistics for the event?

### Scenario:

A friend is planning a wedding and wants to reduce the amount of food served to their guests. They think that having a cocktail hour and a dinner will be enough for the day, but they're looking for feedback from friends about how this might turn out. A friend could tell them that they'll be able to get around a limited number of guests at the dance and cocktail hour, but that dinner will likely be the biggest demand on the food, and they might not have enough space for everyone.

## How do you want to incorporate the new guest list into the event design?

### Scenario:

A friend is planning a wedding and wants to reduce the amount of decoration at the reception. They're looking for feedback from friends on what sort of look they want, but they're also hoping to be able to make the most of the extra space and resources they might have available. They could tell friends that they want to keep some sort of color scheme in mind, but they might not need so many flowers or balloons, and they're keen to use space and resources sparingly.

## How does this compare to other weddings you've attended, or other ideas you've considered for reducing the guest list?

### Scenario:

A friend is planning a wedding and they're considering hosting a cocktail hour and dinner, but they want to be sure to include lots of food for the reception. They're looking for feedback from friends on whether this strategy would be appropriate, even though they've attended other weddings with a similar goal (like keeping costs lower). A friend could say that they've attended other weddings where they found it helpful to have lots of food, and this strategy could help reduce costs, but you'll still want to make sure that you're taking care of the needs of all of your guests.

## How do you manage to do this while maintaining the quality of the event?

### Scenario:

A friend is planning a wedding and they're worried about overloading the rehearsal dinner on family and friends. They're looking for feedback from friends about how to manage this, and they could tell them that they're really excited to have family and friends participate in the wedding planning process, but they're worried that the rehearsal dinner might not be enough to keep everyone on their terms. A friend could tell them that having family and friends involved in the wedding planning process is always possible, and that you don't have to have every guest at the wedding to be successful.

These streams are then processed into fuels like gasoline, jet fuel, or lubricants. The type of crude oil used in the United States is either petroleum or non-petroleum crude oil.

Additionally, petroleum crude oil is also used for military purposes. 

When airplanes and the military run on petroleum crude oil, they produce less harmful byproducts. For example, when aviation fuel is combusted to provide the energy for the engine, it releases carbon dioxide, water vapor and other gases. It is also important to note that petroleum crude oil is less harmful than other forms of fuel like kerosene and gasoline. 
In addition to being less harmful, petroleum crude oil can also be more economical for the military. The military has a limited supply of petroleum crude oil, so they have to be careful of their usage.
